purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the data that identify and characterize products offered to market and of their components. This application module provides specifications suitable for the representation of any kind of such products. In particular, this application module enables the representation of products proposed to market with a great number of variants and whose composition is characterized with boolean expressions of operands selected in a set of product features.
purpose.example: Examples of such products are the products developed by the furniture industry, the automotive industry and the commercial airplane industry.
purpose.p: This application module specifies the data types and their constraints, covered within conformance class 1 of ISO 10303-236.

inscope.li: product structure data: item definition structure, effectivity, classification, and specification control;
actually manufactured physical parts or products identified by their lot id or serial number or inventory number.

outscope.li: any kind of geometric representation other than geometric models placing externally defined geometric models.

sc.description: The subtype_constraint is automatically achieved because all subtypes are mapped onto product_definition and because product_definition.frame_of_reference takes a single value.

usage_guide.guide_subclause:
Realized products are represented, in the MIM, with instances of specializations of product_as_individual.
In real world, in warehouses, real products are identified by a serial number, a lot number or an inventory number.
The serial number shall be conveyed within the id attribute of the product referred to by the product_as_individual.
In order to represent the two other identifiers, instances of applied_identification_assignment shall be created. They shall refer to the product_as_individual through their items attribute. Their role name shall be respectively 'lot context' and 'inventory number'
